declarations.name: serialize
declarations.description:
Serializes a form and returns a plain object. If a form control with the same name appears more than once, the
property will be converted to an array.

declarations.name: sharedStyles

members.name: size
members.description: Size of the identicon in pixels.

members.name: shape
members.description: Shape of the identicon.

members.name: disableTooltip
members.description: Disables showing the tooltip for the hash

members.name: disableCopy
members.description: Disable copying of the hash on click

declarations.name: watch
declarations.description:
Runs when observed properties change, e.g. @property or @state, but before the component updates. To wait for an
update to complete after a change occurs, use `await this.updateComplete` in the handler. To start watching after the
initial update/render, use `{ waitUntilFirstUpdate: true }` or `this.hasUpdated` in the handler.

Usage:

declarations.name: styles

members.name: name
members.description: The name of the textarea, submitted as a name/value pair with form data.

members.name: size
members.description: The textarea's size.

members.name: filled
members.description: Draws a filled textarea.

members.name: label
members.description: The textarea's label. If you need to display HTML, use the `label` slot instead.

members.name: helpText
members.description: The textarea's help text. If you need to display HTML, use the `help-text` slot instead.

members.name: placeholder
members.description: Placeholder text to show as a hint when the input is empty.

members.name: rows
members.description: The number of rows to display by default.

members.name: resize
members.description: Controls how the textarea can be resized.

members.name: disabled
members.description: Disables the textarea.

members.name: readonly
members.description: Makes the textarea readonly.

members.name: form
members.description:
By default, form controls are associated with the nearest containing `<form>` element. This attribute allows you
to place the form control outside of a form and associate it with the form that has this `id`. The form must be in
the same document or shadow root for this to work.

members.name: required
members.description: Makes the textarea a required field.

members.name: minlength
members.description: The minimum length of input that will be considered valid.

members.name: maxlength
members.description: The maximum length of input that will be considered valid.

members.name: autocapitalize
members.description: Controls whether and how text input is automatically capitalized as it is entered by the user.

members.name: autocorrect
members.description: Indicates whether the browser's autocorrect feature is on or off.

members.name: autocomplete
members.description:
Specifies what permission the browser has to provide assistance in filling out form field values. Refer to
[this page on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for available values.

members.name: autofocus
members.description: Indicates that the input should receive focus on page load.

members.name: enterkeyhint
members.description: Used to customize the label or icon of the Enter key on virtual keyboards.

members.name: spellcheck
members.description: Enables spell checking on the textarea.

members.name: inputmode
members.description:
Tells the browser what type of data will be entered by the user, allowing it to display the appropriate virtual
keyboard on supportive devices.

members.name: defaultValue
members.description: The default value of the form control. Primarily used for resetting the form control.

members.name: focus
members.description: Sets focus on the textarea.

members.name: blur
members.description: Removes focus from the textarea.

members.name: scrollPosition
members.description: Gets or sets the textarea's scroll position.

members.name: setSelectionRange
members.description: Sets the start and end positions of the text selection (0-based).

members.name: setRangeText
members.description: Replaces a range of text with a new string.

members.name: getForm
members.description: Gets the associated form, if one exists.

members.name: reportValidity
members.description: Checks for validity and shows the browser's validation message if the control is invalid.
